metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0256 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: In LoadPartitionTable of gpt.cc, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege when inserting a malicious USB device, with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-8.1 Android-9 Android-10 Android-8.0Android ID: A-152874864

notes.Note: sbeattie> requires device with a bad gpt table

criterions.comment: gdisk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
